captions.text: The messages this season complete the previous seasons. They do not contradict them
Your life... Your Decisions
Guide us to the Straight Path
The Business of Death
Let's look at people's interaction with death, across humankind,
So we can understand the blessings of Islam
There have been many falsehoods and misunderstandings
For hundreds and thousands of years
An example: The Cities of Saleh

These are graves, 
The lower class were buried in simple graves
We're ascending now to see the graves of the poor
Look above that mound, there is a little boulder

You can see two adjacent lines.
Those are graves
These graves are for the poor; the lowest class

Some people decided to have a picnic 
in the middle of this graveyard
They had some rice, and onions
Morally this shouldn't be a place for a picnic
The middle class have slightly grander graves
That have carvings, but not proffesional work
They might be slightly smaller but they're middle class
This is called the edifice, or entrance
So this was a boulder that was carved
The dead was buried here with all of his possesions

And the grave is closed with a sheet of stone
or wood depending on the deceased's status
What I used to think were grand places for the rich
Aren't in fact homes, but tombs
This facade shows that this belonged to a rich man

The top shows an inverted pyramid, the theater,
five figures either side
The rich would spend a lot on their tombs
True. Even the location was strategically away from wind
So they wouldn't be eroded

That's why these have survived for 2000 years 
while the poor graves are ruined
This is the biggest and grandest tomb here

There was an inscription that says
"Al-Ihyan Ibn Koza"
Al-Ihyan Ibn Koza and his descendants

These people think that they will be here forever
so they build large tombs
This concept is 2000 years old, but we still see it today
Let's go to America and see
Part of the trade is the tombstone business
There are factories just for this

These are the smallest and cheapest 
They just lie on the ground
And they cost around $400

These are the second level which are bigger
and stand upright
These are of a higher class and so cost $1000 or more

The third level are things like this
Bigger and grander
This costs something like $50,000-$70,000

And even mausoleums have levels
There's another one

There's one like a pyramid over there
Like the Pharaohs

Is this as big as they get?
No, there are even grander ones, like:

The premier tier
Just like what we saw previously

A large mausoleum, a lake, fountains
for a total cost of $700,000
That's why the Muslim poet describes graves, he says

"I visited the graves and called to them
Where is the Great and where is the Scornful?

They had all passed, so there was no informant
For when they died with them died their status"

He describes graves where people go 
but cannot tell who was rich or poor
Because they are all equal
If the poet were to come here he could easily tell
Let's look at the services they offer here
They even put flowers on the casket
The flowers themselves can cost up to $400-$500
And this is one of the coffins they use

$1800 just for the coffin
Or $2000 for this one
Coffins are a huge factor in the business

Because anybody who is to be buried 
must be buried in a coffin
They cannot be buried in cloth like us

It's like organizing a wedding in 4 days
while they are grieving the loss of a loved one
Just like picking out a wedding dress
What you saw today is not unusual
In general, America is a consumerist society

And make a business out of any event
Social or personal, happy or sad
It's completely normal for a priest to send you a bill after a funeral
Even the pallbearers are payed, all of which is included in the bill
In Islam we race to be the pallbearers for the reward from Allah

They [the people at the funeral home] are very nice, 
but business is business

And because it's a business it's for profit
It's not built on principle or values
They do it all for profits
They thought why not have a drive through
So this is the drive through service

So anything to respect the rights of the deceased 
in a holistic and spiritual way to have mercy on the living and the dead
They put the deceased behind glass so that people aren't inconvenienced. They can just stay in their car

What about the environmental impact?
10,000,000 meters of wood
270,000 tons of steel
2,700 tons of copper
1,000,600 tons of cement
All of these resources are used just to be buried

This. This is all a Muslim needs
A simple cotton cloth, lightly scented, and that's it $10
The more modest and simple the service the better
What does it prove when somebody dies and continues to show off?

It shows the heart's attachment to this world
They haven't surrendered to the truth

This cloth represents surrender to Allah
That I have submit to Allah and I am at his mercy and my past deeds

Another problem with gravestones is space
Some cemeteries had to close down
This cemetery in Britain is closed, which means they cannot accept more people due to no space
Let's ask why
She said they don't reserve places here since 2006
It's expected that within 10 years a quarter of British towns will not have any more space in cemeteries
Here in Hollywood this is a graveyard where you can reserve a plot

Guess how much it costs.
$17,000 for this tiny piece

Why? 
Because it's in Hollywood

This one by the lake costs $100,000
It costs so much because of 'the view'

When someone dies they don't care about the view
They are no longer here, it's just a body
Your view is affected by your deeds

The good see their place in Heaven from the grave
While the bad can see Hell

That's your view, you pay with your deeds
Not $17,000 for a "view"
Just to be clear, this isn't in Christianity
Jesus (PBUH) never said you had to be buried in an expensive coffin or expensive plot of land
We must make sure we do not pin this on Christianity

Proper burial is the responsibility of the community
Everyone must take part in it

That's why there are Awqaf (endowments)
Omar Ibn Ilkhattab put aside land for burials
Because burials are everyone's responsibility
Omar Ibn IlKhattab established the Safh Muqattam cemetery in Egypt as a waqf and it is still in use to this day
Even after 1400 years, this land is still in use and cannot be bought or sold
unlike the land we saw in the United States; this is the right thing to do
Because of this business of death, a lot of people now resort to cremation to reduce costs related to burial
42% percent of Americans are now cremated; it's even higher in the UK: 75% are cremated!
People are not being cremated for religious beliefs; Christianity does not call for cremation
It's to reduce costs and spaces
They put the body in a cardboard box, like this, because it's cheaper
Don't worry, the box is empty
Then they put the body here.....
Oh Allah, I seek refuge with you from the fires of hell
The model for payment is distasteful: they charged $150 and then $1 for each pound of body weight
This urn becomes someone's grave
There are different types and sizes; and of course, different prices
Alhamdullilah [Thank God] for the grace of Islam and of course, the obligation to Islam
It's not enough to be Muslim without abiding by its code
Distancing oneself from religion, even here, leads to [this situation]
The Prophet (PBUH) said ""Breaking the bones of the dead is as grave as breaking their bones when they are alive."
Harming the dead and destroying their bodies is equal to harming someone's body when they are alive
Therefore, burning someone's dead body is equivalent to burning someone alive
Part of ikram [honoring] the body is through burial; that's the highest level of honor
Many Arab countries suffer from the same problems that the West suffers from
and unfortunately are following the same path in the business of death
Communities are struggling in the face of the rising prices associated with graves and tombstones, etc.

In one Arab country, prices have doubled in one year!
People are struggling and lamenting

Death is so expensive [for the family of the deceased]
They're even chasing people [for money] to the grave!
In some countries we saw formal price lists for the different types and qualties of graves
We have enough problems as is in terms of the economic and political crises in many of our Arab countries
Are we going to add to our populations' burdens with the issue of death and burial costs?
Are the people expected to live wearily and die wearily also?
It's enough that life here is complicated and there are so many problems and overwhelming burdens while alive. It's enough!
There's no need to add to these burdens and this pain related to death, its costs and the rituals surrounding it
Poor people are buried here, no rich man is going to allow himself to be buried here
Now that we've seen where the poor are buried, let's see where the other classes are buried
This is what is called 'class A' tombs; obviously they are more spacious
They cost about 230,000 Egyptian pounds; that's just for the space and building
This is what the tomb looks like from the inside; there's marble and decorations
Here's the actual grave; are these costs really necessary? Or is using this money on living people more of a priority?
There's even a fan; it's like a house
I designed this myself; if you notice the pillars are like the pharaoh's tombs
Why all of this?
People who have money need something like this
Why is it necessary?
We've had this tradition for a long time
Alhamdulilah [Thank God] we have a Sharia [Islamic code] that has simplified matters
It's shocking to find that people make matters complicated when God has made them simply and easy
The murder of Abel at the hands of Cane - both sons of Adam, was the first burial in humanity
Cane did not know what to do with Abel's body; he learned the simple burial rites by watching a crow bury another
Islamic burial rites are simple and uncomplicated
Humanity has made it complex and convoluted. Why?
We need to go back to basics and simplify this matter
An important person says: I'm important and important people are going to my funeral. How can they find me buried here?
I think they've got things backwards
These are our traditions and ways. If important people are going to a funeral they want to see something beautiful
and ask how much the building cost? Are they attending a funeral or looking at buildings? [Sarcastic about lavish tombs]
Nobody remembers the people buried in these lavish tombs in the USA, Egypt and elsewhere
There is no memory of them! Compare this to the tombs of the most noble of people after the prophets
The Prophet's (PBUH) companions. See this cemetery?
The greatest of the Prophet's (PBUH) companions are buried here: Othman Bin Affan, Jaber Ibn Abdullah,
most of the Prophet's wives, the Prophet's aunt and uncle, Safiya and Al Abbas bin AbdelMuttaleb
and many other companions and early Muslims
See the equality [in tombs], the plainness and humility;
The understanding of: [Quranic verse]"From the earth We created you, and into it We will return you,
and from it We will extract you another time." [20:55]
as well as an understanding of the principle of "the enduring good deeds " [from 18:46]
Grandeur, status and impressive levels after death don't come from marble and tombs
That's why Othman Bin Affan's is known to this day, 1400 years after his death
Ayesha [the Prophet's (PBUH) wife] is known; so is Hafsa, Jaber Bin Abdullah...
These are names known by millions of people today;
not because of the size of their graves but from the size of their actions;
not because of the amount of money they spent on lavishness and piles of stones;
but from what they spent from their time, effort, sweat and actions for khair [what is Good] in their lifetimes
That's what makes one remembered

comments.text:
ياناس الاحظ الشيعه في كل مقطع يتحدث عن الخير ..يحرضون على الشر فجأه كذا 
بكلام غير مقنع للعقل ..ويسبون ..بديت اقتنع بفكره ان الشيعه كانت مدارس من 
صنع الكفر .. وربي بديت استوعب الموضوع ..
مو معقوله ياشيعه في كل مقطع القاكم تشتمون اخوانكم المسلمين..هذا اكبر دليل 
انكم مو اخواننا ..انتم من الكفر والطغاه جايين..الي يقول مايحب ال البيت 
..والي يقول الوهابيه المتخلفين مايبنون ع القبور اضرحه ..مع انها في القران 
واضح انه لايجوز بناء الاضرحه؟؟؟واثقه بهالشي !
وش تبون توصلون له ياشيعه فهموني ..
تبوننا نكفرر؟؟ودتبونا نسب الرسول وصحابته 
تبوننا نبني اضرحه ونحط زهور ونبكي عند المقابر ؟؟وس تبون قاتلكم الله؟ ورد 
كيدكم في نحركم 
كنت احسب الشيعه اوادم لكن طلعو محرضين ع الكفر والنفاق ؟؟﻿

comments.author: Ismail Ali

comments.text:
الله سبحانه وتعالى لم يقل لنبني عليهم مسجدا هذا قران لازم تركز كويس وانته 
تقرء.
الله سبحانه وتعالى قال:
وَكَذَلِكَ أَعْثَرْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ لِيَعْلَمُوا أَنَّ وَعْدَ اللَّهِ حَقٌّ 
وَأَنَّ السَّاعَةَ لا رَيْبَ فِيهَا إِذْ يَتَنَازَعُونَ بَيْنَهُمْ 
أَمْرَهُمْ فَقَالُوا ابْنُوا عَلَيْهِم بُنْيَانًا رَّبُّهُمْ أَعْلَمُ 
بِهِمْ قَالَ الَّذِينَ غَلَبُوا عَلَى أَمْرِهِمْ لَنَتَّخِذَنَّ عَلَيْهِم 
مَّسْجِدًا
لازم تركز على الآيات اكثر قبل ان تتكلم هدانا وإياكم الى الحق وجزاكم الله 
خيرا﻿
comments.author: Love Allah

comments.text:
لا الله الا الله كل اشي بدخلو في سني وشيعي سني وشيعي يا زلمه بكو جننو سمانا 
انتو في الشيعه تبعونكو هوووو من ايمتا الشيعي الو دين في شيعي في الدنيا الو 
دين يعني شيعي نايم جنب القبور وشيعي نايم جنب الاولياء وشيعي بطلب من السيده 
زينب وشيعي بتقرب الى علي عليه السلام من دون الله وشيعي بعذب حاله على شان 
الحسين وشيعي بدو يموت فدا الامه ايووووووووووه هم هذول بيعرفو الله التودد 
الى غير الله كفر كفر كفررررررررررر  هم ال البيت بدهم يستنوك باب الجنه على 
شان يحكولك تعال انتا كنت تعبد فينا ادخل الجنه يا زلمه بلاااااااا 
خرفاااااااااات لا شفيع سوى محمد صل الله عليه وسلم بلا شيعه بلا قرررررف﻿

comments.text:
الحمد لله على نعمة الاِسلام , المقابر في المغرب كلها سواسية تراب وشاهدتين 
الأولى من جهة الرأس فيها اسم المتوفي او المتوفية , سنة الاِزدياد ويوم توفي 
و أية قرأنية ( كل نفس ذائقة الموت ) والشاهدة الثانية من جهة المقابلة لتبيت 
بأنه قبر مكمول لكي لا يدوس عليه أحد فقط هدا هو الدفن , ﻿
